abstract: A federal appeals court will consider an appeal of a lower court’s decision to throw out a $285 million fraud settlement between the commission and Citigroup.
snippet: A federal appeals court will consider an appeal of a lower court’s decision to throw out a $285 million fraud settlement between the commission and Citigroup.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal appeals court granted an emergency ruling late Tuesday that temporarily halted proceedings in the Securities and Exchange Commission’s case against Citigroup. The decision will allow the court to consider an appeal of a lower court’s decision to throw out a $285 million fraud settlement between the commission and Citigroup.

headline.main: S.E.C. Wins Delay in Citigroup Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Wins Delay in Citigroup Fraud Case
